description: A proposed ceasefire deal would see the release of hundreds of Palestinians currently imprisoned in Israel, including some with life sentences.
title: Proposed Israel-Hamas Deal Calls for Release of 800 Palestinian Prisoners

description: Unresponsive patients with severe brain injury may still be conscious despite showing no signs of awareness at the bedside, a recent study suggests. A brain-injured patient who was acutely unresponsive could control his mental activity when instructed to imagine playing tennis, researchers from London, Ont., reported in an Aug. 25 study published in the Proceedings […]
title: Ontario Researchers Find Signs of Consciousness in Unresponsive Brain-Injured Patient

description: The unpredictability of minority governments will make a return to the House of Commons in a few days, with the NDP having dropped out of its deal with the Liberals. NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh announced on Sept. 4 that he had ripped up the supply-and confidence agreement that had been in place since March 2022. […]
title: What Could Trigger an Election Now That NDP Has Broken With Liberals?

description: The Stronach Group says a lawsuit filed by Frank Stronach’s son and granddaughter over management of the family business’s wealth has been settled out of court. The company headed by Frank Stronach’s daughter, Belinda Stronach, announced the settlement in a statement issued Wednesday afternoon. In the statement, Belinda Stronach says she is “very pleased” the […]

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu laid out his nation’s war goals against the Hamas terrorist organization on Wednesday, including retaining control of the strategic Philadelphi Corridor along the border between Gaza and Egypt.

description: Housing prices are forecast to increase by about 6 percent, according to a new report from Re/Max. title: Home Prices to Rise up to 6 Percent This Fall, Re/Max Predicts

description: The union representing foremen at British Columbia’s ports say members have voted overwhelmingly to authorize strike action if necessary in an ongoing labour dispute with port employers. description: The “targeted” shooting of a 15-year-old boy in a North York plaza parking lot was one of three homicides in Toronto over the Labour Day weekend, city police say. title: Deadly Weekend: 15-Year-Old Boy One of Three Toronto Homicide Victims Over Long Weekend

description: A major shift in the candidate lineup for the British Columbia election ballot is underway as the Conservatives take several BC United nominees into the fold, displacing several Tory candidates. description: Vancouver police say a man has been arrested after a pair of “unprovoked stranger attacks” in the city’s downtown that left one man dead and severed another victim’s hand. title: Vancouver Police Say One Man Dead, Another’s Hand Cut Off, in Stranger Attacks

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said he remains focused on the priorities of Canadians after the NDP announced it was pulling out of the supply and confidence deal with his government. “I am not focused on politics. description: The World Health Organization announced on Wednesday that its staff will continue administering polio vaccinations to children in southern Gaza amid its campaign to provide the vaccines across the region during a humanitarian pause in fighting between Israel and the Hamas terrorist organization.

description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Hamas’s recent murders of six Israeli hostages provided Israelis and the international community with a “terrible reminder” of the atrocities committed by the terrorist organization on Oct. 7, 2023, as he announced on Wednesday that he remains committed to defeating the terrorist threat.

description: WestJet has returned six of its 17 damaged planes to service after last month’s hailstorm in Calgary grounded aircraft and forced hundreds of flight cancellations. description: 'Children under the age of 2 should not use digital media at all,' Sweden’s Public Health Agency recommends.

description: The federal Liberals have signed a deal to expand school food programs in Newfoundland and Labrador, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced Wednesday. As part of the deal, Newfoundland and Labrador will receive approximately $9.1 million over […]

description: Some Canadian banks say they’re starting to question how aggressively they go after mortgage customers amid intense competition. description: The NDP has announced it’s pulling out of its agreement keeping the minority Liberals in power, opening the possibility the government could fall before the next scheduled election in 2025. “The deal is done,” NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh said in a social media post on Sept. 4, adding he notified Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on […]
